title: 如果由零開始學，學中文定英文會容易啲呢？

replies.msg:
有冇研究有研究過呢樣嘢？

分別要用幾多時間先可以去到日常溝通到嘅水平？
每個人學第一個語言都係同一速度

quote.msg: 每個人學第一個語言都係同一速度

replies.msg: 咁如果唔係第一語言呢？
English 易
因為英文用拼音 發音上易啲上手

quote.msg: 每個人學第一個語言都係同一速度
咁如果唔係第一語言呢？

replies.msg:
我諗要睇你母語同要學的語言相似性大唔大
例如廣東話正體字 普通話殘體字極相似
一定比英語作為母語的人學得快

quote.msg: 每個人學第一個語言都係同一速度
咁如果唔係第一語言呢？

replies.msg: 睇你第一語言係咩，會唔會有好多share嘅詞語，grammar似唔似，好多野會影響

會唔會可以同動物溝通？

replies.msg: 要視乎你母語同其他你識嘅語言喎

quote.msg:

會唔會可以同動物溝通？

replies.msg:
要睇你點定義咩叫「溝通」
例如透過觀察可以辨認就猩猩唔同動作所表達的意思
而人燶亦可以模仿呢d動作同猩猩「溝通」

睇你母語係邊個語系
你母語係Indo-European語系學英文會易啲
母語係Sino-Tibetian語系學中文會易啲

回樓主，有
利申：中 英 法 日 公開試程度 德 葡 初階完成
個人難度計：
法 >葡 >德 >日 >英 >中(母語)
希望挑戰：
阿拉伯 西 俄 印

The Foreign Service Institute (FSI) has created a list to show the approximate time you need to learn a specific language as an English speaker. After this particular study time you will reach “Speaking 3: General Professional Proficiency in Speaking (S3)” and “Reading 3: General Professional Proficiency in Reading (R3)”

Please keep in mind that this ranking only shows the view of the Foreign Service Institute (FSI) and some language students or experts may disagree with the ranking.

If there is a language in this list you would like to learn and it is in a high difficult category, don’t let this stop you from learning it. Even if they are ranked as difficult, it does not mean that they are impossible to learn and maybe it is not hard for you at all.

Category I: 23-24 weeks (575-600 hours)
Languages closely related to English
Afrikaans
Danish
Dutch
French
Italian Norwegian
Portuguese
Romanian
Spanish
Swedish

Category II: 30 weeks (750 hours)
Languages similar to English
German

Category III: 36 weeks (900 hours)
Languages with linguistic and/or cultural differences from English
Indonesian
Malaysian Swahili

Category IV: 44 weeks (1100 hours)
Languages with significant linguistic and/or cultural differences from English
Albanian
Amharic
Armenian
Azerbaijani
Bengali
Bosnian
Bulgarian
Burmese
Croatian
Czech
*Estonian
*Finnish
*Georgian
Greek
Hebrew
Hindi
*Hungarian
Icelandic
Khmer

Latvian Lithuanian
Macedonian

Nepali

Persian (Dari, Farsi, Tajik)
Polish
Russian
Serbian
Sinhala
Slovak
Slovenian
Tagalog
*Thai
Turkish
Ukrainian
Urdu
Uzbek
*Vietnamese
Xhosa
Zulu

Category V: 88 weeks (2200 hours)
Languages which are exceptionally difficult for native English speakers
Arabic
Cantonese (Chinese)
Mandarin (Chinese) *Japanese
Korean

* Languages preceded by asterisks are usually more difficult for native English speakers to learn than other languages in the same category.

replies.msg:
Sino-Tibetian語系學英文容易啲掛
掌握到th,ch,j,r,l之後唔太難
寫都係26個字母拼

中文學完個音之後仲要學tone
寫又隻隻字唔同
